Content.0: Ark Fiduciaire provides professional accounting, tax advisory, payroll management, and corporate services to businesses in Switzerland.
Content.1: All services are provided in accordance with Swiss law and professional standards of the Swiss Expert Association for Audit, Tax and Fiduciary (EXPERTsuisse).

Content.0: Clients must provide accurate, complete, and timely information necessary for the provision of our services.
Content.1: Clients are responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of their login credentials and for all activities under their account.
Content.2: Clients must comply with all applicable laws and regulations in their business operations.

Content.0: We maintain strict confidentiality regarding all client information in accordance with Swiss professional secrecy laws and the Federal Act on Data Protection (FADP).
Content.1: Our services are provided by qualified professionals who adhere to the highest standards of ethics and competence as required by Swiss professional associations.
Content.2: We implement appropriate technical and organizational measures to protect your personal data and business information against unauthorized access, alteration, disclosure, or destruction.

Fees.Title: Fees and Payment Terms

Factors.1: Time and resources allocated to your engagement

Exclusions.2: Damages arising from client's failure to provide accurate information
Exclusions.3: Force majeure events beyond our reasonable control

Liability.Cap: Our total liability shall not exceed the fees paid for the specific service giving rise to the claim.

Termination.Title: Termination
Termination.General: Either party may terminate this agreement with 30 days written notice. Immediate termination may occur in cases of:

Immediate.2: Circumstances that would compromise our professional independence

Actions.0: Complete work in progress (subject to payment)

GoverningLaw.Title: Governing Law
GoverningLaw.Description: These Terms are governed by Swiss law. Any disputes arising from these Terms or our professional relationship shall be resolved through:

Resolution.0: Good faith negotiations between the parties
Resolution.1: Mediation through a recognized Swiss commercial mediation service

Introduction.Title: Introduction
Content: At Ark Fiduciaire, we are committed to protecting your privacy and personal data in accordance with Swiss Federal Data Protection Act (FADP) and applicable EU regulations.
This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, and protect your information when you use our services.

DataController.Title: Data Controller
DataController.Content: Ark Fiduciaire acts as the data controller for personal data collected and processed in connection with our professional services.

ProfessionalData.Title: Professional Service Data:
Items: Personal identification information (name, address, date of birth)
Financial information (bank details, income, expenses, assets)

WebsiteData.Title: Website Data:
Items: Technical information (IP address, browser type, device information)
Usage data (pages visited, time spent, referral sources)

LegalBasis.Title: Legal Basis for Processing
LegalBasis.Description: We process your personal data based on the following legal grounds:
Grounds: Contract performance: To provide professional accounting and advisory services
Legal compliance: To meet Swiss regulatory and reporting requirements
Legitimate interests: For business operations, fraud prevention, and service improvement
Consent: For marketing communications and non-essential cookies (where required)
Vital interests: To protect your or others' vital interests in emergency situations

ServiceDelivery.Title: Service Delivery:
Items: Providing accounting, tax, payroll, and advisory services
Communicating about your services and account

DataSharing.Title: Data Sharing
DataSharing.Description: We may share your personal data with:
Recipients: Swiss tax authorities and regulatory bodies (as legally required)
Banks and financial institutions (for payment processing)
Professional service providers (auditors, legal counsel, IT support)
Odoo SA and certified partners (for ERP services)
Cloud service providers with appropriate safeguards
DataSharing.NoSelling: We do not sell personal data to third parties. All sharing is conducted with appropriate confidentiality agreements and data protection measures in place.

DataSecurity.Title: Data Security
DataSecurity.Description: We implement comprehensive security measures including:
Measures: Encryption of data in transit and at rest
Secure backup and disaster recovery procedures

Retention.Title: Data Retention:
Retention.Professional: Professional service records: As required by Swiss law (typically 10 years)
Retention.Financial: Financial and tax records: As mandated by regulatory requirements
Retention.Website: Website data: For the duration necessary to fulfill stated purposes
Retention.Marketing: Marketing data: Until consent is withdrawn or data is no longer needed

YourRights.Title: Your Rights
YourRights.Description: Under Swiss data protection law, you have the right to:

Access.Title: Access
Access.Description: Request information about personal data we hold about you

Rectification.Title: Rectification
Rectification.Description: Correct inaccurate or incomplete personal data

Erasure.Title: Erasure
Erasure.Description: Request deletion of personal data (subject to legal obligations)

Portability.Title: Data Portability
Portability.Description: Receive your data in a structured, machine-readable format

Object.Title: Object
Object.Description: Object to processing based on legitimate interests

YourRights.Exercise: To exercise these rights, contact us at info@ark-fid.ch. We will respond within 30 days.

InternationalTransfers.Title: International Data Transfers
InternationalTransfers.Description: We may transfer personal data outside Switzerland to:

Destinations.0: EU/EEA countries with adequate data protection
Destinations.1: Countries with adequacy decisions from Swiss authorities
Destinations.2: Third countries with appropriate safeguards (standard contractual clauses)

InternationalTransfers.Safeguards: All international transfers are conducted with appropriate legal safeguards to ensure your data remains protected to Swiss standards.

PolicyChanges.Title: Changes to This Policy
PolicyChanges.Description: We may update this Privacy Policy to reflect changes in our practices, services, or legal requirements. Material changes will be communicated through:
PolicyChanges.Effectiveness: The updated policy will be effective from the date specified in the revised version.

Contact.Title: Contact Us
Contact.Description: If you have questions about this Privacy Policy or wish to exercise your rights, please contact us:

Cookies.Title: Cookies Policy
Cookies.Subtitle: Information about our use of cookies and tracking technologies

Introduction.Title: Introduction
Content: This Cookies Policy explains how Ark Fiduciaire uses cookies and similar tracking technologies on our website. It provides information about what cookies are, how we use them, and your choices regarding their use.
By using our website, you consent to the use of cookies in accordance with this policy and our Privacy Policy.

WhatAreCookies.Title: What Are Cookies?
WhatAreCookies.Description: Cookies are small text files that are stored on your device (computer, tablet, or mobile) when you visit a website. They allow the website to recognize your device and store information about your preferences or past actions.
Contents: The name of the server that placed the cookie
An identifier in the form of a unique number
An expiration date (some cookies only last for the duration of your session)

Essential.Title: 1. Essential Cookies
Essential.Description: These cookies are necessary for the website to function properly and cannot be disabled.
Essential.LegalBasis: Legal basis: Necessary for service provision

Analytics.Title: 2. Analytics Cookies
Analytics.Description: These cookies help us understand how visitors interact with our website by collecting and reporting information anonymously.
Analytics.LegalBasis: Legal basis: Legitimate interests / Consent (where required)
Analytics.Providers: Providers: Google Analytics, internal analytics tools

Functional.Title: 3. Functional Cookies
Functional.Description: These cookies enable enhanced functionality and personalization features.

Marketing.Title: 4. Marketing Cookies
Marketing.Description: These cookies track visitors across websites to display relevant and engaging advertisements.

ThirdParty.Title: Third-Party Cookies
ThirdParty.Description: Our website may include content or services from third parties that set their own cookies. These include:

Duration.Title: Cookie Duration
Duration.Description: Cookies are classified by duration as follows:
Types: Session Cookies: Temporary cookies that are deleted when you close your browser
Persistent Cookies: Remain on your device for a set period or until manually deleted

Lifespans.Title: Typical Cookie Lifespans:
Items: Essential cookies: Session duration or up to 1 year

ConsentBanner.Title: Cookie Consent Banner
ConsentBanner.Description: When you first visit our website, you'll see a cookie consent banner allowing you to:
Options: Customize your preferences by cookie category

BrowserSettings.Title: Browser Settings
BrowserSettings.Description: You can also control cookies through your browser settings. Most browsers allow you to:
Options: Clear all cookies when you close the browser

DisablingImpact.Title: Impact of Disabling Cookies
DisablingImpact.Description: Please note that disabling certain cookies may affect your experience on our website:
Effects: Essential cookies: Website may not function properly
Analytics cookies: We cannot improve our website based on usage data
Functional cookies: Personalization features will be disabled
Marketing cookies: You may see less relevant advertisements

DoNotTrack.Title: Do Not Track Signals
DoNotTrack.Description: Some browsers include a "Do Not Track" feature that lets you tell websites you do not want to be tracked. Currently, there is no accepted standard for how websites should respond to Do Not Track signals.
DoNotTrack.Response: We respect your privacy choices and are monitoring developments in this area to implement appropriate responses to Do Not Track signals when industry standards are established.

Updates.Title: Updates to This Policy
Updates.Description: We may update this Cookies Policy from time to time to reflect changes in technology, law, or our practices. When we make significant changes, we will:

Actions.0: Update the "Last Updated" date at the top of this page
Actions.1: Notify users through our website banner or email (for significant changes)
Actions.2: Request renewed consent where required by law

Contact.Description: If you have any questions about this Cookies Policy or our use of cookies, please contact us:
